policy 3514  environmental safety status  adopted original adopted date  02062016  last reviewed date  02062016 board education recognizes obligation provide safe healthy environment school facilities students  staff  community members  superintendent designee shall regularly assess school facilities identify environmental health risks  heshe shall establish comprehensive plan prevent andor mitigate environmental hazards based consideration proven effectiveness various options  anticipated short term longterm costs andor savings district  potential impact staff attendance  student attendance  student achievement  strategies addressed district s plan shall include  necessarily limited  following  1 ensuring good indoor air quality maintaining adequate ventilation  using effective maintenance operations reduce dust  mold  mildew  indoor air contaminants  considering air quality site selection  design  furnishing new remodeled facilities 2 limiting outdoor activities necessary due poor outdoor air quality  including excessive smog  smoke  ozone  ultraviolet radiation levels indicate high risk harm 3 reducing exposure diesel exhaust air contaminants limiting unnecessary idling school buses commercial motor vehicles 4 minimizing exposure lead paint  soil  drinking water 5 inspecting facilities naturally occurring asbestos asbestoscontaining building materials pose health hazard due damage deterioration safely removing  encapsulating  enclosing  repairing materials 6 ensuring proper storage  use  disposal potentially hazardous substances 7 ensuring use effective least toxic pest management practices 8 instituting food safety program storage  preparation  delivery  service school meals order reduce risk foodborne illnesses developing strategies promote healthy school environments  superintendent designee may consult collaborate local environmental protection agencies  health agencies  community organizations  superintendent designee shall provide district s maintenance facilities staff  bus drivers  food services staff  teachers  staff appropriate professional development regarding responsibilities implementing strategies improve maintain environmental safety schools  superintendent designee shall notify board  staff  parentsguardians  students  andor governmental agencies  appropriate  environmental hazard discovered school site  notification shall provide information district s actions remedy hazard may recommend health screening staff students  board policy manual maxwell unified school district
